library.name: A Comprehensive Bibliography on Syriac Studies

bib: Moss, Cyril. “Amphilochius of Iconium on John 14, 28: ‘The Father Who Sent Me, Is Greater Than I.’” Le Muséon 43 (1930): 317–64.
citation: Cyril Moss, “Amphilochius of Iconium on John 14, 28: ‘The Father Who Sent Me, Is Greater Than I,’” Le Muséon 43 (1930): 317–64.

data.title: Amphilochius of Iconium on John 14, 28: “The Father Who Sent Me, Is Greater Than I”
data.abstractNote:
"The Homily ["Oratio in
                    illud: "Quia pater maior me est"" (Ioh. 14, 28) ("uersio
                    syriaca")] is an attack on the Arians. These heretics asserted on the basis
                    of such Texts as John, 14,28. : "My Father is greated than I", that
                    Christ is manifestly inferior to the Father. Amphilochius energetically combats
                    their position. In the first part of his sermon he shows on logical and
                    philosophical grounds that it is impossible for a man rightly to maintain that
                    God the Son is less than the Father, such an assertion being a derogation of the
                    Father's honour and not simply an attack on the Son. [...] The second part
                    of the discourse is devoted to a refutation of the Arian position from
                    Scripture. In this section we have inter alia, a detailed exposition of John,
                    14, 23-15, 1." Three biblical passages quoted in the Homily: Samuel I, 9,2
                    ; Wisdom 1,7; Ephesians 2,14.
